result.execSummary:
The defendant Donald G. Benton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: defendant's JOC - mailed to him 12-31-15 - not deliverable as addresssed
per Judy @ ONSO - in custody - ONSO

2:56 p.m. Defendant Donald G. Benton in court.  Jodie Bendar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Bednar statement to victim rights compliance - no further contact from victim. Defendant enters no contest plea.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty.
Court Sentence
WHS/POP - 1 year
Supervision Fees
  Fine/Forfeitures/Court Costs are not a condition of probation and are to be paid in full directly to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days unless a payment plan has been approved and set up through the Clerk of Court's Office.
DNA Sample
  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO
Appeal rights given.
Adj. 3:06 p.m.  Review hearing scheduled for March 28, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

2:37 p.m. Defendant Donald G. Benton in court.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court questions defendant regarding counsel. Defendant states spoke with Amy Ferguson - Defendant wishes to proceed on own - Waiver free and voluntary - Defendant pleads no contest. Schiek states needs to comply with victim rights. Bail continued. Adj. 2:45 p.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 29, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

1:48 p.m. Defendant Donald G. Benton in court with attorney John O'Melia.   Jodie Bendar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. O'Melia appearing specially. Bednar statement. O'Melia states defendant will be contacting Attorney Ferguson and/or public defender. Defendant provides address/phone number of 611 W. Kemp Street. 920-327-1393 - will be moving this weekend to that address. Court quashes warrant--authorized but not yet issued. Judicial Assistant will schedule adjourned initial appearance. O'Melia directed to contact JA for date. Adj. 1:54 p.m.
